subject: Re: getting TestRunner to see junit.samples.AllTests
msgSnippet: Thanks The final result that worked is JUNIT_HOME=C: J2SDK_Forte CLASSPATH=.;%JUNIT_HOME% jnit3.7 junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME junit3.7; which is equivalent to

The final result that worked is
JUNIT_HOME=3DC:\J2SDK_Forte
CLASSPA=
TH=3D.;%JUNIT_HOME%\jnit3.7\junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME\junit3.7;

which is equiv=
alent to
CLASSPATH=3D.;C:\J2SDK_Forte\jnit3.7\junit.jar;C:\J2SDK_Forte\juni=
t3.7;

which I'd tried before but it didn't work - I thought.

What I disco=
vered is that I had to drop out of the DOS window after
each change of the =
environment. I'd make a change in the environment
to CLASSPATH but stay in =
the DOS same DOS window so it never saw the
change.

Thanks for thinking ab=
out this. Clif
